Package main

Class CommandInterface

java.lang.Object
main.CommandInterface
All Implemented Interfaces:
MyClient.ClientCallback
public class CommandInterface extends Object implements MyClient.ClientCallback
This class obfuscates the process of sending and validating commands to the robbie app using the MyClient class. This class also handles some of the environment information locally to reduce the number of commands sent to the robbie environment host.

Valid commands and responses are specified in the RobbieCommands document

Author:
Jared Schimpf

  • Constructor Details

    • CommandInterface

      public CommandInterface(String address, int port, boolean showMsg) throws Exception
      Constructor

      Establishes the connection to the robbie app host listening at the given address and port. ShowMsg enables or disables the messaging feature of the robbie app once a connection is established.

      Parameters:
      address - the address to attempt the connection at
      port - the port the address should be listening on
      showMsg - boolean that toggles the detailed messaging display on the robbie app
      Throws:
      Exception - if there is address or port values are null or if mMyClient fails to establish a connection.

    • CommandInterface

      public CommandInterface(String address, int port, boolean showMsg, String grid) throws Exception
      Override of the constructor that also attempts to initialize the grid during object construction
      Parameters:
      address - the address to attempt the connection at
      port - the port the address should be listening on
      showMsg - boolean value that toggles the detailed messaging display on the robbie app
      grid - the name of the grid file for the application to load, which must be in the same working directory as the robbie app on the host machine
      Throws:
      Exception - if there is address or port values are null, if mMyClient fails to establish a connection, or if grid initialization fails.

  • Method Details

    • sendRespond

      private String sendRespond(String msg) throws Exception
      Internal method: Sends out a message, then returns the response. Throws an exception if the response was null, or a CMDFAIL or CMDERR response.
      Parameters:
      msg - The message to send
      Returns:
      The received response message
      Throws:
      Exception - if no response is sent within the timeout window

    • sendRequireResponse

      private void sendRequireResponse(String msg, String expected) throws Exception
      Internal method: Sends out a message and checks if the returned message matches the expected string, Throws an exception if it does not match.
      Parameters:
      msg - The message to send
      expected - The expected response message
      Throws:
      Exception - if the received message doesn't match the expected response.

    • sendRequireStartsWith

      private String sendRequireStartsWith(String msg, String expected) throws Exception
      Internal method: Sends out a message and checks if the start of the returned message matches the expected string, then returns the response message
      Parameters:
      msg - The message to send
      expected - The text that the response should start with
      Returns:
      the received response message
      Throws:
      Exception - if the received message doesn't start with the expected response

    • setShowMsg

      public void setShowMsg(boolean b) throws Exception
      Sends a message to the host to toggle the socket messages display on or off.
      Parameters:
      b - boolean representing enabling or disabling messaging: True= messaging on, False= messaging off
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond

    • Connect

      public boolean Connect()
      Attempts to establish a connection to the host, returns True or False depending on success.

      (this method is unused because the MyClient class already automatically attempts to establish a connection when a message is sent for the first time)

      Returns:
      boolean indicating the success of the connection attempt

    • stop

      public void stop() throws Exception
      Sends a message to the host to end program execution.
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond

    • initGrid

      public void initGrid(String filename) throws Exception
      Sends a message to the host to load the grid with the given file name
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the grid file to load
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond

    • getSize

      private CommandInterface.Coord getSize() throws Exception
      Internal method: sends a message that queries the host for the dimensions of the currently loaded grid
      Returns:
      Coord record that holds the current x and y dimensions of the grid
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond

    • getGems

      private int getGems() throws Exception
      Internal method: sends a message that queries the host for the number of gems robbie has currently collected. This value is also tracked and updated locally. This method queries the host for the value only if there is no local record. This is done to reduce the number of queries to the host as they can slow execution quite a bit.
      Returns:
      The current collected gem count
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond

    • initGems

      public void initGems(int gems) throws Exception
      Sends a message to the host to overwrite robbie's current collected gem count with the value of the passed in integer. This is typically done to initialize robbie with a certain number of gems.
      Parameters:
      gems - The value to set the collected gem count to.
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond

    • addGems

      private void addGems(int gems) throws Exception
      Internal method: sends a message to the host to increase robbie's current collected gem count by the passed in integer. Negative values will decrease this count.
      Parameters:
      gems - Value to modify the gem count with
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond

    • getDir

      public String getDir() throws Exception
      Sends a message to the host that queries the current direction that robbie is facing. Expected responses form the host are: "UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", "RIGHT"

      This information is also tracked locally by the program, a query is only sent if the local record is blank otherwise, this returns the local value.

      Returns:
      A string representing the direction robbie is facing, either: "UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", or "RIGHT"
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond

    • faceDir

      private void faceDir(String dir) throws Exception
      Internal method: sends a message to the host to change the direction robbie is facing. Expected inputs are: "UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", "RIGHT"
      Parameters:
      dir - A string representing the direction to set robbie to face,

      either: "UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", or "RIGHT"

      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond

    • turnRight

      public void turnRight() throws Exception
      Sends a message to the host that sets the direction robbie is facing to the right of its current direction
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond

    • turnLeft

      public void turnLeft() throws Exception
      Sends a message to the host that sets the direction robbie is facing to the left of its current direction
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond

    • getLoc

      private CommandInterface.Coord getLoc() throws Exception
      Internal method: sends a message to the host that queries for robbie's current x and y coordinates on the grid.
      Returns:
      A Coord record that contains robbie's x and y grid coordinates
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond

    • step

      public void step() throws Exception
      Sends a message to the host to move robbie forward 1 space in the direction it's currently facing. This is done by incrementing/decrementing robbie's current coordinate location by 1 based on his direction.
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond

    • goTo

      private void goTo(CommandInterface.Coord loc) throws Exception
      Internal method: sends a message to the host to change robbie's position on the grid to the passed in coordinates
      Parameters:
      loc - the x and y coordinates to move robbie
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond

    • getGrid

      private String getGrid(CommandInterface.Coord pos) throws Exception
      Internal method: sends a message to the host that queries the content of the grid at the cell of the passed in coordinate
      Parameters:
      pos - the coordinates of the cell to check
      Returns:
      the content of the grid at the cell, expected:

      "X": represents a wall

      "0".."9": represents a gem count, 0 being an empty cell

      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond

    • setGrid

      private void setGrid(CommandInterface.Coord pos, String val) throws Exception
      Internal Method: sends a message to the host to modify the grid cell at 'pos' to the passed in value 'val'
      Parameters:
      pos - the coordinates of the cell to modify
      val - the value to set the cell
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond

    • take

      public void take() throws Exception
      Handles the 'take' robbie instruction by 'taking' the gems in the cell adjacent to robbie in the direction it's facing via a series of commands to the host which are handled by the takeAtCoord helper method.
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond.

    • takeAtCoord

      private void takeAtCoord(CommandInterface.Coord loc) throws Exception
      Internal method: Sends messages to the host to set the gem count to zero at the cell located at the passed in coordinate 'loc' and increase robbie's gem count by the value that was at the cell.
      Parameters:
      loc -
      Throws:
      Exception

    • drop

      public void drop() throws Exception
      Handles the 'drop' robbie instruction by 'dropping' a single gem in the cell adjacent to robbie in the direction it's facing via a series of commands to the host which are handled by the DropAtCoord helper method.
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond.

    • dropAtCoord

      private void dropAtCoord(CommandInterface.Coord loc) throws Exception
      Internal method: sends command messages to the host that query for the contents at the passed in coordinate 'loc', then increases the gem count at that cell by 1 if it's a valid location (not a wall cell or a cell with 9 gems). Robbie's total gem count is then decremented by 1.
      Parameters:
      loc - the location to drop a gem
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond.

    • checkFacing

      public boolean checkFacing(String dir)
      Checks if robbie's direction matches the passed in direction.

      Valid directions: "UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", or "RIGHT"

      Parameters:
      dir - the expected direction
      Returns:
      boolean value representing whether robbie is facing the passed in direction.

    • hasGem

      public boolean hasGem() throws Exception
      Checks if robbie's gem count is greater than 0
      Returns:
      boolean value representing whether robbie's gem count is greater than 0
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond.

    • seeGem

      public boolean seeGem() throws Exception
      Checks if there's a gem adjacent to robbie in the direction its facing
      Returns:
      boolean value representing whether robbie sees a gem
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond.

    • getAbsDir

      private String getAbsDir(String relDir) throws Exception
      Converts a direction relative to the direction robbie is facing:

      ("FRONT", "RIGHT", "BACK", "LEFT")

      to a grid absolute direction:

      ("UP", "RIGHT", "DOWN", "LEFT")

      For example, if robbie is facing left, his front would = left, back = right, left = down, and right = up

      Parameters:
      relDir - the direction relative to robbie's direction: ("FRONT", "RIGHT", "BACK", "LEFT")
      Returns:
      the absolute direction of the relative direction: ("UP", "RIGHT", "DOWN", "LEFT")
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the passed in relative direction is invalid, or if querying robbie's direction returns an unexpected response.

    • checkClear

      public boolean checkClear(String relDir) throws Exception
      Checks whether there is a wall adjacent to robbie in the specified relative direction
      Parameters:
      relDir - the direction relative to robbie's direction to check
      Returns:
      a boolean value indicating if the checked cell is clear of walls
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an unexpected response or the host fails to respond.

    • clientStatus

      public void clientStatus(String msg)
      Override of MyClient's client status that specifies the format of the messages.
      Specified by:
      clientStatus in interface MyClient.ClientCallback
      Parameters:
      msg - status message
